alert.note: Alert for Kittson (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks (Northeastern North Dakota and Northwestern Minnesota)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 13 at 10:32AM CDT until further notice by NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Grand Forks ND has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Minnesota... Red Lake River at Crookston affecting Polk County. Two Rivers River near Hallock affecting Kittson County. .Temperatures above freezing over the last several days is creating snow melt, with some areas in the southern basin seeing most of the snowpack melted. High temperatures will remain above freezing and is expected to further ripen the snow pack where it still exists and, with anticipated melting, will cause increased flows of water into the rivers. There will be variations as to degree of snow melt depending on how high temperatures will get over the next several days. This will impact rate of rise in many locations, with some rivers responding quickly and other forecast points seeing a delay in rising levels. At this time, precipitation will be limited. However, if rainfall occurs later over the next few days, it will have an impact on forecast rises. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. ...FLOOD WARNING FOR SNOWMELT IN EFFECT FROM SATURDAY AFTERNOON UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Two Rivers River near Hallock. * WHEN...From Saturday afternoon until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 806.0 feet, MODERATE FLOOD STAGE. Storm sewers start backing up. Storm sewer valve at TH175 bridge closed. Lift pump inspected. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:00 AM CDT Thursday the stage was 796.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage early Saturday afternoon and continue rising to a crest of 805.5 feet Monday evening. The crest may vary between 804.5 feet and 806.5 feet. - Flood stage is 802.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Safety message - Turn around, don`t drown. Don`t travel through flooded areas. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
